intro: Rondeletia rupicola var. chiribiquetana, commonly known as the Chiribiquet rondeletia, is a flowering plant native to the Chiribiquet region of Colombia. It is characterized by its slender, woody stems and small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or red. The plant thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to the tropical and subtropical climates of its native habitat. It is often found in open, sun-exposed areas and is considered an endemic species due to its restricted distribution. The plant's botanical features make it a unique and valuable component of the local flora.
